Review.Titre: Chrome browser extensions do not work. Invalid CRX file
1Password is an absolute trash piece of…
Review.Contenu: 1Password is an absolute trash piece of software.  It is filled with glitches, totally inconsistent in performance, and will slow you down interminably when you try to access previously hassle-free websites.  Be prepared to reset your passwords constantly in the hope that 1Password will eventually recognize one of them and use it consistently.  Customer Support is virtually non-existent.  They can't explain or resolve any of these reported issues.  They simply offer you three free months of usage in the hope that you can figure it all out on your own.  Do NOT, repeat NOT, waste your time trying to use this software.  It will leave you more frustrated and angry than you can imagine.Post Script:  The response from 1Password below this post is a total smokescreen.  They control this website and will delete any posts that are critical of 1Password.  All of the info requested in their response had already been provided to 1Password.  This included (at their request) a detailed list of issues/problems encountered with the implementation and usage of the software.  1Password's response?  An email that advised that they had closed my account.  No attempt whatsoever to resolve the multiple problems and issues.  As I stated before, do NOT try to use this flawed software.  It will give you nothing but grief.

1Password refused a negligible account credit refund request, despite having the discretion to fulfil it.I have no qualms with 1Password crediting an account, where applicable. However, if a customer requests a refund of their hard-earned cash, which is likely the exception rather than the rule, 1Password should do the right thing by the customer.In September 2023, 1Password announced it had surpassed $250 million in annual recurring revenue. Holding on to negligible $$ during a 'cost of living crisis' is just bad for customer experience.Update (15/12):Just to respond to the below comment, there is no suggestion here that 1Password have refused to credit the account(s) automatically. As noted above, this is in relation to a credit-refund, which has been refused.With 4 (soon to be 6) Business Accounts, and 2 Personal Accounts, I'm not perceiving any "billing event" or "account-level change"; which basically means 1Password will sit on my hard-earned cash for the remainder of eternity.1Password's refund policy states: "We’re unable to issue refunds for past charges or for any time remaining on your account at the time of cancellation". However, I have cited to them an instance of them already doing this for myself on another account. Furthermore their Terms of Service states:"While all amounts paid are non-refundable, certain refund requests for Subscriptions may be considered by AgileBits Inc. on a case-by-case basis and granted at the sole discretion of AgileBits Inc."So in this case, 1Password has the discretion to be able to honor my request, and deliver a positive customer experience, they're just choosing not to.Thus, poor customer service experience - 1 star.

Review.Contenu: I wish I hadn’t use it. The day after I started using it my YouTube started having some highly suspicious search histories. This was supported in LastPass.2-Not possible to save shared passwords into my vault if I don't use their extension. This was supported in LastPass.3-Even if I use the extension, I need to put my master password in every single time in order to save shared stuff into my vault. This is not ideal as my password is 25+ characters long(for security purposes).4-Poor UI, equally poor as LastPass.5-Import from LastPass missed almost half of the passwords.

When you are stuck locked out your site is a bunch of instruction about what you could have done to recover your account, but the steps to recover are lower or not clear.  It talks about family recovery but not, apparently, for my account type: individual.If someone is locked out your site becomes infuriating. It is NOT helpful.  It is just a bunch of junk at that point, and talks about what you could have done to recover your account.fix this by actually putting yourself in the shoes of someone who is locked out.  Fix this by putting the person's password in the recovery kit that they should save, instead of having that part blank for them to fill out themselves.  Fix this by allowing multi-factor recovery like phone number, or separate device/phone auth allow.  Multi-factor app like authy/authenticator should also be a method of recovering an account. Show the password to the person as they are changing their password, so they can see misspellings. They can also screenshot their password for saving in the cloud as part of the backup.BE MORE CLEAR that if they mess this up then they will hate you because you can't help them recover.I almost had to delete my account and start over again.  I was just trying to change my 1password master pass to safeguard my details, and I almost lost my account.  NOT COOL.It makes me want to stop using your service.  I probably will if this EVER happens again.

Review.Titre: Terrible transition to an electron app.
Review.Contenu: Terrible transition to an electron app.We went from a 30/40MB memory footprint to an app that uses 10x that memory and keeps 6 to 7 processes in the background running in parallel.Honestly, it doesn’t shock me. Most companies do this under the guise of improving the product to their customers.It’s a lie unfortunately. They do this to ease their development, not really to improve user experience.That’s the state of software.Will be moving to Bitwarden this month. If I have to have this downgrade in experience might as well support an open source alternative, even if their UI/UX isn’t the best.

Review.Titre: Power users should avoid - your favorite features are temporary and will be removed next.
Review.Contenu: I don’t mind the change to Electron. I don’t mind the change to a subscription model - I actually appreciate this if it allows companies to fund further development without accepting VC dollars and chasing infinite growth. I do mind that with every major release there is a retraction of features. Of the ability to segment credentials into individual vaults and select which vaults are active. I do mind the constant spurring of longtime users and power users."Collections" and having to fundamentally re-create my 8-year-plus-old vault organization is not an equitable feature.

Review.Titre: Do NOT use this password manager!  Locked out of account WITH username and password!  No customer support!
Review.Contenu: Update: Although the customer service is responding to the 1 star reviews, there is no indication that 1Password resolved the issues.  I also filed a BBB complaint and Econsumer.org complaint (because they are not US based).  Those are the type of things that get responses so I encourage anyone else having an issue to do the same. Review: Yesterday I migrated all my data from LastPass to 1Password because 1Password comes so highly recommended.  I deleted my LastPass account upon migration of my information to 1Password.  This morning I did a factory reset of my Macbook Air and opened Safari to log into 1Password.  I entered my username and password.  But 1Password does not recognize my Mac - and wont let me sign in without my security key! So because of a bug in their system, I’m completely without access to all of my important data.  I can't access any of my email accounts today.  I had appointments booked on online platforms I can’t access.  I am missing work.  I can’t even communicate with anyone about why I'm missing work, because I’m unable to get into ANY accounts.  I’ve reached out to customer support all day with no response.  I finally resorted to contacting them on twitter - no response.  I Password is preventing access to information I need for day to day, minute to minute, living.   I missed work today.  I’m missing emails from clients.   And no response at all from the company.Update: It’s now 10:00 pm.  Customer service ignored my communications all day leaving me unable to work (online platforms).  I do not use a smart phone.  I use a light phone (the dumb phones that barely call and text).  So I had literally no way to recover access to ANY account all day.  I am a freelance worker.  My income depends on fast responses to customer requests.  My ratings and reviews on freelance websites are calculated based on how quickly I respond to customer requests.  So while 1Password has chosen all day to ignore my communications, I have lost both clients and ratings. I have several screenshots showing unanswered communications with 1Password on their social media.
This is insane. Subscriptions are evil. The idea of having your passwords held hostage by subscription sharks...1Word = Stupid.

I utterly hate this App. I have been trying up upgrade from version 7 to 8 and it is utterly impossible. It has taken my hours and hours and I still haven't sorted it out. There is no support, every time you click on a button it just open another pop up with impenetrable instructions on how to migrate an account, it is utter rubbish.I have just been asked to provide more information on this review by Trustpilot on pain of the review being taken down. I am very happy to offer more information but the reply does not allow more data to be provide so I will put it here. I have been using Password 1 for many years, however it has always been very clunky and not user friendly (I am a Mac user and I expect things to work without having to have an understanding for the operating system or be a programmer). Recently I was told by Password 1  that version 7 would cease to work and I needed to migrate to version 8 (I had already tried to move to version 8 previously but gave up trying). That migration process is insanely complicated, the advice is badly written, the links on their webpages just simply don't take you to where you need to be, the whole process is opaque. Eventually I have now managed to set up version 8 but entirely by chance - I have not idea how it worked or whether all my data has been transferred. Furthermore, I now seem to have two accounts with slightly different data. The whole thing is an utter shambles. Finally there is no obvious route to find support. If you click on the support links  it simply takes you to the opaque instruction you started at in the first place. In the past I raised a query with their support team, when they could not help me they simply closed the ticket.What I should have done it written down every password I have and used the browser password systems instead. I have no confidence that when I next long in to Password 1 any of my data will still be there.UPDATE 26 June 2023Since I managed to upgrade to Version 8 I now get a pop up in Firefox saying that the Password 1 add on does not work. I raised another ticket with Support and they responded, "1Password is unable to function in Firefox if you set the browser to "never remember history" or "always use private browsing mode". These options prevent all add-ons and apps from saving, collecting and accessing data in the local storage, and 1Password can't work correctly without accessing data in the browser cache. Unfortunately this is a browser limitation."So Password 1 are recommending leaving one of the main doors to cyber security, your browser history, unlocked and wide open. UTTERLY ASTONISHING

Review.Titre: I decided to setup a password manager…
Review.Contenu: I decided to setup a password manager and move away from apples keychain around two months ago.  I was really hoping the experience using 1P would be at least as good as using apple KC across my apple devices.  I must say that I routinely find myself having to go manually open 1P to generate a password (it's not detecting the prompt correctly on many sites) as well as just being able to even see the 1P suggestions (b/c brave and KC sometimes show their options).  Additionally, there should be a way to right click or long tap a suggested password so you can go right into it in 1P and modifiy it.  My import of credentials resulted in tons of duplicates (average of 2-3 per entry) and there is no simple deduping process in the app.  Now that apple added password sharing via KC, I'm starting to think I should have stayed on the apple KC...  You guys must get to feature and useability parity with apples own KC as a priority..
The apps/website/extension all are different and the UI features are not the same. Search should be simple and available at all times for the whole enterprise.

Both the android app and my other password manager confirm that I have the secret key and my master password stored correctly. But the firefox and chrome extensions intermittently will not let me sign in to 1password despite multiple checks and copying and pasting my secret key and password during the attempted sign-in process from its storage in the 1password android app and also from my other password manager..Ditto the windows app which persistently tells me I have either or both my secret key and my password wrong.  Just in case it might be a problem with my PC,  I've also tried the installation on a second windows laptop,   and also with my firewall temporarily disabled.  Still no joy.   I'll await support's response.  For clarity,  I have not used 1password  for any passwords yet,  as until I can successfully sign in properly,  I cannot import any passwords from my other password manager.

Review.Titre: Lots of issues and room to grow in the Support area
Review.Contenu: I see a good number of issues with the support I got:1. Agents changed quite regularly. I got about 3-4 agents over about 10 messages. This meant that new agents had to get up to speed, may not understand the issue very well, and have different focuses, which caused the approach to vary each time they changed. Not a good, contiguous support experience. 2. Agents made broad statements about my account state without explaining how this affected my account state or influenced my path forward. Essentially, they provided information I couldn't use as presented. 3. Agents uniformly focussed on the "next step" and confirmation of details that sometimes other agents already confirmed (see number 1, above), and were not focussed on my goal, so their approaches, uniformly, were much more complicated than they needed to be. It may be their responses were somewhat scripted, which could explain it.4. The wait between replies was not conducive to getting the issue rectified in a timely manner. I think I spent 3 days on this.  Should have taken 2 hours max. 5. Ultimately, I figured it out myself, as I got so frustrated with circular responses and waiting, that I tried some things and hit on something that worked quickly. Wish I'd just done this earlier. Support didn't really do anything for my immediate issue. They did, however, send me a link to delete a derelict account. The one thing that I found helpful, I guess. I added one star because the support staff were friendly, and seemed to want to help. Just couldn't, very well.PS. I see 1Password had a reply. No, sorry, you're twisting my words. If you read my post, the support staff were absolutely UNABLE to help. But they were friendly. I figured it out myself after waiting a long time.

Except I couldn't type my secret key correctly. I just want to take a picture instead of type.

Not for power users, but the best I was able to find for my my requirements. But still it's often annoying how difficult to handle. No clever handling of rescue codes; handling of syncronized password between several services with different domain/hostnames; very often failing to recognize changed passwords and in consequence not updating the vault entry.

I used to really like 1password, but upgrading from a normal account to a family account has been a complete and total nightmare. Basically you can't do it. You have to export your vault and reimport it, but for some reason the option to import it is greyed out. Now I have no passwords in my vault on my Mac, all the ones online and support just send me stock email.

I had to change my review from 5 stars to 3 because the windows application is absolutely impossible to use. It is hard to change the password, I cannot change the password and update the existing password, it cannot scan a qr code for 2fa. Just terrible

Too many problem to connect. Each time there is an update, this is the same problem.Does not work properly on mac.Since the last update, cant fill the loggin information automatically.When i press the shortcut, its writtent "install chrome extension" although its already installed.Tried to update it, but no changes. Not the first time i have this problem, but really. Its bothering

When 1Password works, it's terrific.  The problem is that it's the least intuitive piece of software I've ever seen.  Nothing is easy - or obvious.  And sometimes things just don't work - for no apparent reason.  I've spend the last 30 minutes trying to save a new login, and it won't work.  And I've been using the software for several years.  Be forewarned.

I find 1password frustrating.  It tries to remember logins for the change password page and then doesn't save it for the ACTUAL login page.  It seems to muscle its way to block safari from inserting the password when I haven't yet transferred that login info to 1password yet.  At this point, I am disappointed, feeling frustrated and wishing I had never started using 1password.  It is also more difficult logging into things on my iPhone since I can't seem to use it by just unlocking my phone like I can with the built-in password saver on iPhone.

I initially thought this would be a helpful program but it is too clunky to access with the long initial password each time. After cursing each time I entered that password incorrectly, I found that I resorted back to my old paper flip-notebook tucked in a pocket for my passwords. Maybe old habits die hard but low-tech has some advantages in my opinion.

Review.Titre: What should work in theory too often…
Review.Contenu: What should work in theory too often fails due to inability to register the randomly created new passwords.  Also when using a tablet or phone the passwords created with the Chrome extension on the computer fail.  Sorry I purchased with the one year billing, money down the drain.  I do better creating my own passwords and storing in Chrome.  Am deleting the extension from chrome and cancelling subscription.  Also wasted are many many hours working on this to try to get it to operate properly.

I have been using this software for years, ever since it was bundled with some Mac software for a few dollars.I was then forced to upgrade with a paid version for around € 15 a few years ago.Now I find out that the Agilebits gentlemen have converted to a monthly / yearly subscription model. OMG, are we talking of Adobe's Creative Cloud here?It seems to me a disproportionate cost for features offered (and I assume development costs), a demonstration of pure greed by AgileBits.Sooner or later they will make my perpetual license unusable (I already have some functionality limitations) and force me to update.It is time to look elsewhere. Thank you.

Review.Titre: I've been using 1password for years now…
Review.Contenu: I've been using 1password for years now and other competition of yours like lastpass and many others, what I really hate and upsets me from 1password and almost make it perfect is that there is no "sharing"The sharing is copy paste an account into another vault but you can not share in real time an account example netflix etcI don't want to share vaults, I want to share specific items from my vault to another person's vault

Review.Titre: This is now a subscription service. That is too High Risk for me
Review.Contenu: I first tried moving to this Password Saver in 2011 because my Password Manager at that time was already more than 10years old. I found 1Password cludgy and difficult too use, so never fully transferred from my "old" faithful Password Manager. I am glad I never did. I want to own and have such sensitive software under my control. Anyone trusting any subscription or internet  based Password Manager is begging for trouble sometime in the future!

Review.Titre: The intuition portion of this App is…
Review.Contenu: The intuition portion of this App is going downhill quick. I have had multiple instances where turning on this app has caused more problems than solutions. Not remembering correct passwords, not suggesting updating a password, having multiple logins of the same site, the apps nor working, not prompting for face ID on iOS.. i can literally list many more. I am cancelling my subscription today and moving to somewhere else that doesnt just update the UI monthly. UPDATE YOUR FUNCTIONALITY.

Review.Titre: Managing bulk information is not easy
Review.Contenu: Managing bulk information is not easy. You cannot select multiple items and move them to another vault. The interface is pretty good overall. There are bugs on mobile devices and computers forcing you to go out of your way to do something in order to be able to enter credentials. 1Password has become very essential, however, 80% of the time it is faster and easier to just copy and paste a password from a spreadsheet. The price is about right, but considering the lack of innovation over the years, I am disappointed.

I've been working to set things up for a number of hours. This app is not simple, does not supply detailed explanations, a search function is somewhere but I can't find it. Wish I never had started with this app.

Previously a wonderful tool, but has become a nightmare after upgrading to the latest version. My iteration now works fine, after much struggle: However, an approved family member has had nothing but problems and it's impossible to contact a live human  with whom to work thorough the issues.

1password took an annual payment ($43.06) without notification. I put a support ticket in 5 days ago and have had no response other than an automated email with links to upgrade etc. Support ID [#YNX-18747-682] in case 1Password staff read this.Very disappointed.Update - 1Password have now refunded my payment.

1Password seems to work well for technical people only. I tried to have my family and close relative to use it with my family plan, and the setup process was too complicated and everyone got frustrated.For example, if you don't use PC and only use mobile phone, try to enter the 20+ secret key without another device to scan the barcode. There are many email confirmations during the process, I got into a state where I need to delete the account and re-add the email, but invitation email no longer send out to my family member.

Review.Titre: I have used 1 Password for about 2…
Review.Contenu: I have used 1 Password for about 2 years. I have found it to be cumbersome to use when updating passwords. Support is nonexistent for an individual user like me.  I presume that the product is intended for large account users with in-house IT support.  I will be seeking alternatives.

Review.Titre: I bought a "lifetime" license for one…
Review.Contenu: I bought a "lifetime" license for one password in 2015. I guess I must be dead. It seems I have been forced out of that and on to their ridiculous subscription model. I have just uninstalled this software. Lifetime license my hat. Got greedy and forgot about the people who made them.Why would I buy this software again? You'll just upgrade it, (which means change the way it looks - everything else is the same) then charge me again. Edit: Support has reached out and is "determined to help me" so we will see.

Review.Titre: I wo want this to work
Review.Contenu: I wo want this to work, but as I set this up, I routinely get "no code response from server" messages, and I've also gotten locked out as well.  Pretty awful experience, and not seeing the value.

Review.Titre: I updated my passwords for both 1Pass…
Review.Contenu: I updated my passwords for both 1Pass subscriptions and I can't open it on my computer. You can't get help from anyone at 1Pass unless you want to trade many many emails and then your problems don't get solved.

Review.Titre: It may be rated well, but I find it much too complex to use.
Review.Contenu: This program has been rated as the best password manager, so I thought I would give it a try. I find it incredibly complex to figure out how to use.I have watched all the useless YouTube videos, and clicked everywhere I can, but nothing works logically. The program signs me out every 10 minutes, so I need to re-enter my master password constantly. I can't figure out how to find the settings. I thought I was fairly technically savvy, but this program is way too difficult to learn.I'm glad I only signed on for a trial, because I will cancel when it's over.

1Password is getting less and less intuitive to use. 1PasswordX won't show my iCloud vault and I haven't been able to find preferences to change that. Where the heck did the Password Generator go? Is 1PasswordX just a browser extension and 1Password7 the standalone application? They don't look the same and don't act the same... At least not on my machines. Very disappointed in an app that I've recommended to dozens of friends and family prior to the increasingly convoluted user experience. Shopping for new password clients now.

Review.Titre: The latest version of the app (8.5) is…
Review.Contenu: The latest version of the app (8.5) is appalling. The search function cannot be limited by vault, the interface is "funky" instead of clean, and I can't find an older installer.

Limited 2FA options to protect your account. Supports RSA type authentication (6 number code) but has no options for face id/fingerprint reader/gesture from a mobile device like my phone. I'd love for the second factor to be any of my phones security features.

Review.Titre: It was my most trusted software
Review.Contenu: It was my most trusted software. I loved it and admired agile for their thorough support. What happened? Well, they figured they could make more by shifting us all to a "subscription" model. Now keeping the 1passowrd extension for safari up and running( if you have not moved to the subscription model) is time-consuming.If you like paying for your software monthly and carefully monitoring those transactions for errors and omissions ... then go for it. If like me, you would prefer to buy software with a single transaction, then BUYER BEWARE.

the premise is wonderful and I have been a member for over a year. I gave p a year ago on truing and then was refilled was so tried again. This is potentially the most frustrating experience I have had in years, and I am computer savvy.  The fact that there is no phone number to call is infuriating and makes it extremely difficult. I get redundant answers to my questions and for one month now have not been able to use it well-- I have to retype my master password every time I log in to a new site so it defeats the entire purpose. I will cancel if it does not make my life easier in the next few days.  They really need a 800 number!!!!!

I have been an early adopter and love the app. However, they have the absolute worst customer service. I purchased the app but they now blocked it (saying free trial is over). Despite their claim a human will get back, none of my emails have ever been answered, very poor.

Review.Titre: Took a few months to realise how good…
Review.Contenu: Took a few months to realise how good Lastpass truly isIt's been a few months now since starting using 1Password after a transition from Lastpass.Can say that it's been insanely frustrating.1Password is constantly unable to launch the correct application, fill the username and asks for my Secret key all the time which drives you insane.
Thanks for the help still need assistance with connecting all my team accounts

Review.Titre: Gets mixed up with other password apps…
Review.Contenu: Gets mixed up with other password apps and it sometimes wont pop up to updata the password, you have to constantly re-enter super long secret passkey in every browser, hassle more than ease.

Review.Titre: I like the idea when it works
Review.Contenu: I like the idea when it works. Sometimes it doesn’t. So far it works enough to be helpful. I wish we could get better training on how to make it the first and only password provider but often feels like it’s competing with the other password programs.

Review.Titre: Overall I am happy on my resolution but…
Review.Contenu: Overall I am happy on my resolution but I believe my account should have been fully checked before making a conclusion.Thanks

Review.Titre: You need a tutorial for iPad
Review.Contenu: 1Password seems to be a great password manager but I have a problem-i am 76 years old and would love a very basic tutorial for my 3rd generation iPad. I subscribed 6-8 weeks ago and still need help in getting up and running on iOS.

Review.Titre: Useless without support for local vaults
Review.Contenu: Since 1password has dropped support for local vaults altogether, I am forced to look for an alternative.I don't mind having my account online, and obviously if I want to sync credentials across devices they have to be in the cloud.But I have to, for security compliance reasons, store a subset of credentials in a separate, local vault that is not synced in the cloud. It is completely O.K. if I cannot edit those vaults unless I am logged in and online, I understand that 1passord needs to managed subscriptions somehow.But I need to be sure those credentials never leave my local system, and be able to access those credentials from the vault in read only mode locally from another PC.Every person that wants to manage private, work related, and more strictly classified secrets in the same app, will have the same requirement.1passord will have to decide if it wants to be a pure consumer app, or also a business app. Currently it is the former.

Review.Titre: 1Password developers gave up and decided to just phone it in
Review.Contenu: 1Password used to be a shining example of the best a Mac app can be, but with 1Password 8 they abandoned it, and instead put in the bare minimum effort: an Electron app. For those that don't know, Electron is basically a Chrome web app. So 1Password 8 lacks the macOS interface polish that Mac users expect (and were in 1Password 7).Electron apps are used when developers can't be bothered to put in an effort; it show they don't care about the platform or its users. The only thing worse than an Electron app is no app at all.

Review.Titre: It is virtually impossible to reach a…
Review.Contenu: It is virtually impossible to reach a human being in tech-support. Email responses are so slow. Bottom line is I have been grappling with the app for the past five months and still cannot get it to download and store all my existing passwords, also new passwords don’t appear to be loading either. It is the cleanest Password storage app I’ve come across it seems easy to use, but it doesn’t appear to work and I can’t get anyone on tech-support to walk through this with meAsked for a review. You got one

I only have one concern at this time and that is syncing my systems, be it Mac, PC or Android, It's driving me crazy trying to log in with countless errors of invalid password. and reset requirements.

1Password is not as intuitive as I hoped. The company should make it's own video tutorials on its site, or share on YouTube.The customer support email response time is reasonable not that I know how you operate, but your advertisement as 24/7 is very receptive. It's more like wait 24 hours and we'll get back to you. The technical responses aren't as clear as I hoped. The last one pointed me in a direction and I figured into the solution on my own. You should be able to move or copy items from vaults using the cursor and click and drag.

The biggest problem is  it is having to keep logging into it, why is there an always on, option or is there?  It hovers over when I am logging in which I find annoying asking to login in to it. Uggggh, hence 3stars, I use a file password protected in word cos it doesnt always pick up passwords, some how it needs an ack and nack, so I dont trust it enough

I made the step from 1P 7 (local use) to cloudbased 1P 8. It is very comfortable to use it everywhere, on any platform. BUT: 1P 8 is much more complicated than 7. 1P 8 does'nt work as seamless as 7 and still has a lot of bugs. And: 1P 8 doesnt behave like a real application anymore... the windows, the look and feel - it's always a web app. I'm hoping for improvements!

1Password, works but is a PITA to use!I paid to use it and omitting two factor authorization in the standard version is a terrible limitation.  Passkeys - I am afraid to use because I am not sure it is supported by 1 Password.I like to shutdown my browser when I am finished with a website. so on a single browser I have to sign in to 1Password many times per day.  I use 3 different browsers(edge, chrome & firefox) so the number of sign ins per day is tripled.1 Password has trouble with sites that have old passwords stored.  Not easy way to delete old signs that no longer work.I do not believe that this solution is less work than my old methology.

Great password manager that's sliding downhill. Peaked at the version 7 edition of the add-on and desktop app, but they're aggressively pushing 8. Add-ons no longer work with 7. 8's a crappy electron app with horrible UI that lags, goes completely white/blank, buggy TOTP generator that doesn't work half the time, and search is entirely broken (try searching for anything with a "." in the name, like "my.admin" using ".admin" - it'll show everything containing the word "admin"). If not for these issues that they refuse to fix and continue to make worse, it'd be an amazing product. The usability going downhill is literally my only complaint.

Review.Titre: Great product with some refinement needed
Review.Contenu: Overall, I have learned the program and its great. However, your popups need an X so you can close them and get them out of the way when filling out forms. They pop up on stuff that you evidently don't have the info to autofill. The update feature for new passwords isn't as smooth as it should be and often saves new PWs and overwrites the old before the new is accepted to the system. Often your strong password doesn't comply with system settings. It would be great if we had some input for a max length and special character exclusion.

Review.Titre: I am afraid I may have thrown away $50
Review.Contenu: I am afraid I may have thrown away $50.  I work for a company that mandates me to change my password every quarter.  So far I haven’t gotten the program to do what I thought it could. I wanted to use the same master password and when my company desires me changing the password, I thought your system could provide them a different password as I would command the program to generate and reuse the new generated password even though I’m unlocking one password with my same master password.  Any training videos for an idiot like me?

Review.Titre: Not simple enough for the older folks.
Review.Contenu: It starts off quite simple till you really get into it,like wanting to import or export items,when a login is stated incorrect and you know it is correct and you have to figure it  out. Also, I am 76 years old and that is probably  part of the  problem.

Review.Titre: Unwieldy upgrade from personal to families, customer service people good
Review.Contenu: It was really hard to upgrade from 1-user (personal) to the family plan. However, the customer service people kept working with me and we eventually got it done. The problem was signing up via the app , through Apple, vs signing up online directly, apparently. It works pretty well, but not on every website, though often you can call it up, copy the info, and paste when needed when it does not come up automatically at sign-in to a given site.

Dear Dave, I have lost a little faith in 1Password. Recently I had several crashes of version 7 on my Mac. It wasn't until I installed the ugly and impractical version 8 that I got my passwords back. Version 8 is not only unfamiliar to use, but it is also completely designed past what I am used to. Collections and vaults? Who thinks up such an operation? Oh well, your forum is full of good suggestions from customers. Good luck!

1password has continually prevented me from doing my job.  When I am trying to log in it interferes with the process by placing a 1Password notice over what I am doing thus requiring me to stop and deal with it.  Once I comply, it does not allow me to continue my work but forces me to start over again.  Why can’t it operate in the background instead?  I appreciate the value of your application.  However, being a professional Human Factors Engineer, I find it far from being "user friendly."

Review.Titre: I wish I could give 1password 5 stars
Review.Contenu: I LOVE 1password. I adore it. The app has looked amazing for years, it’s secure, it’s extremely well thought out. However, I cannot with a good contious give it the 5 stars it deserves after the 1p version 8 update and moving away from a native app. The non-native app experience, and moving to an electron app is just so sluggish and so much more resource demanding. It’s such a disappointment from such a good and Mac-first company such as 1password.

Review.Titre: I dislike the 'no in person, phone support' policy…
Review.Contenu: I like the quick email reply to my request for help.  But I dislike the 'no in person, phone support' policy. My issue could have been solved with a 10 minute phone call.  Instead, the issue took several email back and forths plus about 30 minutes of my time following the email guidance, which failed the first few attempts.

I find navigation on 1Password apps and sites inconsistent and confusing. I just tried to find the Windows app and had to search in their support knowledgebase that led me to a page where I could download it. A consistent navigation bar at the top of apps, websites that starts with - 1Password home - then consistent categories across all pages and applications please.I discover new menus clicking on tiny arrows in the corners of pages.. it really is a voyage of discovery. I find myself considering less confusing and cheaper alternatives.

Review.Titre: Family account manager can at a click of a button delete all your data without warning!
Review.Contenu: Although 1Password seems like a great password manager I'm a bit disappointed learning that any family account organizer without warning can delete your family account including all your passwords, notes, emails etc by the click of a button.Solution: Just have the option to boot them from the plan and let the account go into individual trial mode.This is a huge oversight that needs to be resolved as quickly as possible. This issue has been discussed years ago and still, nothing is been done about it.

Review.Titre: Nice app with some growing pains
Review.Contenu: I've been using 1Password for years, and admired the progress of the app.  However, there is a persistent bug that relates to in-app updates on macOS.  On both of my M1 Mac Mini's, checking for an update, then going through the process of the update results in an endless loop indicating there is still an update.  I had to completely remove 1Password (using AppDelete) and manually download the latest version for the update to install.Each new update requires this tedious process.  Guys - you need to squash this bug.

Review.Titre: I always download updates; too complicated
Review.Contenu: I always download updates, esp. for newest security improvements.  So when 1Password v.8 came, I downloaded it.  As often happens with updates, some things stopped working.  Like the open and fill.  I contacted service via email. It took 6 exchanges over 7 days to fix it.  Lots of computer lingo went way over my head.  The last one simply said, download 1Password for Safari, gave me the link.  That did it.  Glad to have it fixed, but took too long.   And do not approach the general public with computer lingo or expected expertise.

Review.Titre: Maybe I'm being dumb but on my Galaxy…
Review.Contenu: Maybe I'm being dumb but on my Galaxy S8+ it asks for my 1Password everytime I need to add a new password. The password for the Password program is purposefully hard to remember so I just don't use it much. I like the Google system better and will probably opt out soon

When it works, it’s great, but there’s a lot not to love about 1Password, and it’s hard to get support except in small bites separated by the length of their shifts (e.g. every 12-15 hours or so). It’s also been impossible for me to figure out how to get it to autofill with Android phone and tablet. (Yes there are steps to follow but they haven’t made any difference.) And now somehow the setting that has helped me avoid having to login every time I want a password filled in has died, and I dread the 2-3 day slog I’ll have to go through to fix it.

I’ve been a 1Password customer for several years. It works pretty well but updates are a pain. I’m confused about the prompts for permissions. Also I can’t say the log in process at web sites is as smooth as it can be. I’m often prompted to log in, even after I’ve used touch ID.

Review.Titre: I like it creates new passwords I dont have to remember
Review.Contenu: I like it creates new passwords I do not have to remember.  I still have not figured out to use my family vault and use the password program with my mom on her computer or phone.  It has been very confusing.  It has taken me a lot of time to even get it so it reconizes my links and logins.  I still dont know how to sign in propererly.  I have to remember that one very long password and I have to make it work for my mom.  It is a bit frustrating.  I eventually will have everything set up correctly and be able to get into all my accounts.

Review.Titre: Getting started is complicated and frustrating
Review.Contenu: I wasn't overly happy in the beginning as getting it set up was really complicated and full of glitches. The technical support was good and prompt though. Now that I'm up and running I'm reasonably happy with it. However I wish the passwords were more customizable. Some of the websites won't accept passwords longer than 15 characters, or they specify that symbols must be certain ones. I find myself clicking through suggestions trying to find ones the site will accept. Even the "smart password" option doesn't bypass this. I'd like to be able to choose password lengths based on what the site wants, and select or deselect special characters, etc. I was able to do this in Lastpass.

Review.Titre: Good human support after bad Chat bot
Review.Contenu: Have send a question to the general mail of 1Password.The chat bot gave me an answer on a different question.After asking for a human made answer my question was solved correct and immediately

Review.Titre: Has worked welling the past but no…
Review.Contenu: Has worked well in the past but no stand alone license anymore, which is a bad development. Confusing to upgrade from version 7 to "Family" version 8 and no obvious phone support on their website. I'll try once to contact them and if no luck, I'll be changing to something else.

To be frank, the experience i had was not what I wanted. I wanted to expand 1password to my wife, tried to get it to work and wasn't successful.  So I have reverted back to individual plan. It just seemed I would try and follow directions and end up not getting 1password to open on her computer.

The latest redesign is confusing. I've been using password managers for over a decade and this is the most confusing update yet. It's impossible to find anything and the constant offline notifications are distracting. It's hard to recommend this as a product

Review.Titre: It took me almost three days and…
Review.Contenu: It took me almost three days and several support emails from a support bot before I could actually get real support from a human. Once there was human interaction with the support problem I was able to quickly get up and running. All of my problems could have been resolved in less than a day and just a few emails. The use of the bot support system was a major problem for me and almost made me look into switching to a different Password Manager. Other than that, I would have been able to give a 5 Star Rating.

Review.Titre: It took a little while to figure out…
Review.Contenu: It took a little while to figure out how to recover the files.  It turns out the info in emails was correct, you can recover a file, but all of the links with help/aids were not specific.  at the end of the day you cannot do it from your app, or pc app, but need to log in on the web - and scroll to the very bottom of the file to find the recover link.very unintuitive and would have been solved much quicker if the links with information were clearer.

Review.Titre: I came from Lastpass and I have to say
Review.Contenu: I came from Lastpass and I have to say, Lastpass had a better user experience. It's annoying to login every single day on the same machine. Find a better way to keep the login saved in the machine.In the browser, when login for the first time in a website, it will be better if you suggest to add it into the database. The extra step to go into the save and add button is more uncomfortable.It's complex to go and edit a saved item, it requires several steps. It can be done in less steps.The user experience on apple products with face id it's very smoothly, however, without the biometrical feature it's not so good.I hope the feedback help you to improve the product, it's really good. Ping me if you need more feedback, you have my email.

My son convinced me that I needed 1password to secure my many online accounts. I’m not the most tech-savvy and I struggled a bit syncing my account on iPhone and MAC.  I signed up for a family membership and my husband did not want to participate. I wanted to change the family plan to a single plan.  It was a bit frustrating not to have a contact phone number and be forced to communicate via email. However, response time was helpful and somewhat timely. Not the immediate fix of a phone call but it sufficed.   Having a customer service phone number would make the 3-star experience 5-star experience

Review.Titre: I am a registered client and am trying…
Review.Contenu: I am a registered client and am trying to move my account from Android to IOS after being hacked on Google and facebook. But the app keeps trying to give the free startup and I cannot sign in to iOS or access my subscriptions Regards Laurence Welsh

One Password is good, BUT... please stop sending mails out begging for reviews on trust pilot. I don't know but its feels off a bit for a product that is well done. Autofill on Android and Windows needs some attention in the future, but its fine.

Review.Titre: Great password manager / UX quality dropping
Review.Contenu: Great password manager, but with the recent move to unify the development under Electron, the UX has considerably dropped for Mac users (and increased for Windows users)As a Mac user, I only keep using it because there is no better alternative, yet.

I like the functionality, however the chrome extension is not very smooth. I need to login too many times, and it takes a whole lot of effort to continuously fill that (hard and long) password again. I already did all the troubleshooting. Using Brave browser. I'm paying quite a lot, so I feel like this "best" password manager can see some improvements!I'm waiting on their reply now.

Review.Titre: The support staff were friendly and…
Review.Contenu: The support staff were friendly and obligingResponse was timelyHowever I basically had to solve the problem using my own nouse and intuition.I sent a number of messages detailing specifically the issues I was experiencing including a screenshot...The responses did not address the matters causing me problems.

Review.Titre: I have a tolerate-dislike for your system!
Review.Contenu: I have a tolerate-dislike for the way 1 Password is managed.  Unlike all the other Applications I pay for one password has no telephone number for getting support.  Who example, I tried to use one password on my iPad mini and was asked to purchase it even though it is supposed to be covered by my subscription.  Why is this?

I started using 1Pw in 2014—with the most expensive plan available, “pay once, use it forever”. Do I like 1Password?Yes, I had a great experience with 1Pw for years and my passwords “survived” many intruders and scandals, be it on Tumblr, Twitter…. What I don’t like:However, more recently, I had to realize that features were removed, limits and thresholds tightened, restrictions of usage applied, and so forth. So, basically my license was downgraded over and over again. Cannot even edit existing passwords on my desktop anymore. Cannot add new photos/files, devices… Doesn't feel like a “thank you” for early customers/adopters

I can say that all of the Support Staff have been very kind, polite and patient through this inquiry... and many others before it.  They need to be, because the transition from 1Password7 to 1Password8 (or, simply "1Password" - a source of confusion in itself) has been confusing and frustrating. In the most recent case, the advice was not completely correct, but I was able to figure it out through some trial-and-error of my own.

Review.Titre: Everything was nice except the LastPass…
Review.Contenu: Everything was nice except the LastPass import simply didn't work and I had to fall back to the less secure .csv import method. The feedback for the failed import was terrible and inspection of the diagnostic json suggested an incorrect password even though I confirmed I used the correct password across several attempts. I also tried the beta desktop client since the update notes indicated a lot of work on LastPass imports, but that also didn't work.

Review.Titre: Newfound problems with using this app.
Review.Contenu: I have long found this the best way to keep track of passwords and it has a reputation for trustworthiness. However, recent changes in its business model have prevented me and my wife from sharing use of the site, and I have been unable to get direct, in-person help with fixing the problem.

Just signed up after deciding to leave LastPass.  The setup has not been intuitive at all.  Very convoluted process as each setup step shunts you back to a page that has no information.   Down loaded apps and am still unsuccessful in importing my LastPass data.   Someone needs to look at this process as it is not user friendly.   E.g. there is NO file menu in the app, just a ... in upper right corner that looks more like a windows utility box rather than something for the program.  Something very Windows 3.0 looking.   I'll keep trying but I am losing my patience.  Best

Review.Titre: I'm not able to install the app
Review.Contenu: Edit: to be clear - the app is working great on mobile and web and I'm very satisfying with it!I'm not able to install the app (on win11)I keep getting this message:"1Password was unable to complete installation and will roll back any changes."

I received a new phone recently and had trouble configuring one password. In particular, I had trouble configuring an authentication app, and tried to find a way to speak to someone at 1Password directly, but couldn’t find a link. I was ultimately able to solve the problem myself, but it took longer than I had hoped. I submitted a question to 1password support, but never received a response.

Review.Titre: Was hoping for a more satisfying…
Review.Contenu: Was hoping for a more satisfying experience. There is no email, chat or option to get info if you have a question. Creates a dead end for the user. The blogs are not user friendly.

Review.Titre: I like everything about the product but…
Review.Contenu: I like everything about the product but one small item.  I would like that, every morning when I power up, you app starts and remains active.  I end up starting your app 8 to 10 times a day..... Like when I tried to submit my review I had to log into 1Password to activate it AGAIN.

Cannot import from another password manager.  Have not received a solution from 1Password Support.  Picked them because reviews said they had great 24/7 support.  Glad I have 13 days left of the free trial, but I guess this is one way to burn through the free time without really getting to test the features of this product.  Found fix on Reddit.  Apparently 1password knows about the issue, and the workaround is to import the CSV file using the browser version, but they have yet to respond to the folks having issues with it and let them know that's a possible solution.  Support should make this known to all their new users.Finally heard from 1Password and they are aware of this problem.  They're trying to fix it, but it would be nice if they let people know about it immediately and provide the workaround.Changed review to three stars.

Review.Titre: Your clients may not be computer savvy.
Review.Contenu: I liked prompt responses, but after 6 days, my problem still exists. I wanted 2FA added to my account which it was to my version7 of 1Password. Support suggested I update to version 8 and I did. Now I have both versions but not 2FA on version 8. I have received many responses from support but I still have a problem. I have lost a great deal time and it's frustrating. My ignorance may be part of the problemThank you,Hal Tanner

Review.Titre: I really like 1Password for the Mac but the v8 installer is odd
Review.Contenu: This is about the 1Password 8 installer. I really like 1Password for the Mac but the installer is very confusing. For one, I had no idea if I have a stand-alone vault of whatever the other thing was, which the webpage listed. It would be good if it told how to figure this out. Then downloaded installer asks for a password but the user name didn't make sense. No combo of user names and password (Apple, 1Password) worked. But eventually the installer succeeded and everything seems to have imported. I'm quite confused but happy to have 1password updated now. So, if you run into this problem... I guess just wait and it will work.Maybe?

Review.Titre: Some websites do not use ALL characters…
Review.Contenu: Some websites do not use ALL characters which makes it VERY awkward.At least 1 website won't fill in auto ; have to click on autofil

1password is my favorite password manager. If it could support sub-domains, it could be my best password manager.Today, I need to select user credential when I login sub-domains and I sometimes select wrong credentials.

Review.Titre: Not clear about the steps needed to…
Review.Contenu: Not clear about the steps needed to transfer data from a different password manager, or the steps needed to use 1password.  Is there a tutorial to make 1password use easy?

Review.Titre: Not clear if the software was installed…
Review.Contenu: Not clear if the software was installed - a confirmationn would would give you that good feeling of everything is done correct

Review.Titre: Overall great, but no longer a strong leader
Review.Contenu: I've been a strong user of 1Password since around 2010.Recently I've been having no end of issues. 1Password freezing and being unresponsive, causing the browser to freeze, shortcuts not working, and date formats only showing in US format. Although I like the new design, there are just too many problems.Support hasn't been very helpful and I'm now getting to the point where after 12 years I'm considering a new password manager.

I am 94 and have found 1Password difficult to use.  I can’t always figure out how I works.  It would be helpful if there was a manual of some kind.  Maybe there is and I just don’t know where to find it.

Review.Titre: I like your proactiveness for cybersecurity
Review.Contenu: I like your, what seems like, diligence for security. That is my primary concern.I was a longtime user of LastPass. The breach broke my trust in LastPass. My next concern was the ease of a replacement. Especially, for my wife’s using it. (She and I both have post Master’s level college degrees. However, us 76 year olds have not concerned ourselves very much with keeping up with the latest computer tech other than what we have to.)With that in mind I chose DASHLANE because of its user friendliness. However, the determining factor in choosing 1Password over DASHLANE was the attention to security.However, the lack of guidance of a knowledgeable living person by 1Password is still frustrating me and I am STILL trying to sort through sharing the MASTER PASSWORD for accessing certain personal information that relates to both of us!  Also, I’ve just learned that our bank is not aware of 1Password or, therefore, what I need to do to use 1Password with my accounts. I’m having to log on manually. I am physically disabled so it’s difficult to visit our bank and it’s 20 miles away. I suggest you consider that a niche market?I also suggest 1Password consider the senior adult market! There are millions of us and we would welcome a dedicated line to a live 1Password person for guidance in setting up an account. I fully realize the challenge and that it would take people who have the communication skills for it.I look forward to learning to use a pass key with 1Password. But, I have my concerns about how we would have passkeys always with us on our persons.I am greatly encouraged about 1Password. Frankly, I am concerned about Canada’s political situation. Your leader seems to be willing to take control of anything he decides to. That makes me wonder about the future true security of my/our personal data.
Confusing: notification says app will no longer be supported. Download version 8 for Mac from 1Password site.  Application installer identifies version 7? What is wrong with this?
It's ok - works well for most, but on my phone sometimes takes too long to pop up to autofill or not at all. Definitely a time saver though

Review.Titre: Used to be great, keeps getting worse.
Review.Contenu: Used to be great, has gotten progressively worse over time. Successive updates have removed features, some large (like local vaults), some small. On Mac, I've had to reinstall the app twice in the past week after updates render it "unable to be opened".The new JavaScript-only browser extension now takes ~20 seconds to unlock every time I'm asked for my master password; the classic extension which communicated with the desktop app was instant.It used to be a native macOS app, and felt like one. Now feels like any other website pretending to be an app, but at least all the platforms are now at parity. To be fair, this change is an upgrade for those who mostly use the app on Windows, but it's a shame we had to lose one of the better native Mac apps in the name of easier cross-platform support. I'll still use 1Password, but I miss the days when it was a solid recommendation to pretty much everyone I knew.

Review.Titre: Critiques Installing on a new computer
Review.Contenu: Critiques Installing on a new computerCritiques: 1. The share link from iPhone and using airdrop a great idea, but it is a link to open the app. Problem: I didn't have MacOS app installed, so no feedback except for a AirDrop beep and nothing happens. Confusing, better direction needed because you need to install app first.2. Where is the app to download? Apple app store has ipassword 7, I was pretty sure there is 8, is it available, where to get it, did something happen with Apple, 7 is an editors choice??? For me a google to finds the download for ipassword 8, and I download. I'm a developer so I get to the next step. Do I trust where I'm downloading from a search(? not really). All concerning and not clear,  as I trust y'all with with my passwords!3. Getting installed on all my browsers confusing requires changing my default browser. Again love the idea that y'all have the automatic download from the app link figured out for my default browser. But I want it installed in all my browsers, I realized I can hack it by changing my default browser the clicking the link.Props, good job making all this work. Some care went into making it easy. But now there is more to improve. I've got my entire family, sisters, and mother now using, I'm a software developer so I can figure this stuff out, but many in my family would be lost trying to get things started, and they are still challenged to use it. No question 1password is so much better than the alternative!

Review.Titre: I’m 86 and I have tough time getting…
Review.Contenu: I’m 86 and I have tough time getting the program to work for me. Some items I got to work but some I had a hard time to change to 1Password passwords without any luck

Review.Titre: App itself is pretty good, but very poor customer support
Review.Contenu: App itself is pretty good. but very bad custom support. i switched from lastpass and needed help to setting things up. they asked me to give them more details, so i gave it to them. but still didn't get any reply for 4 days.
Super difficult to establish account and move other passwords over - I spent most of the day and I still don't know where the two authentication code went
Password 7 was an easier to use app - and it worked more conveniently was opening and not constantly requiring a password.
I'm very impressed and I think there's almost nothing to do better. Thank you so much.

Review.Titre: I ended up with muliple passwords on…
Review.Contenu: I ended up with muliple passwords on some accounts.

Review.Titre: Support is okay be prepared to wait a long time to resolve an issue
Review.Contenu: While I do admit that while yes 1password did finally manage to resolve my issue it took several emails back and forth with little progress for the longest time with a fair amount of trying the same thing over and over again with predictable results it took posting negative reviews before I finally got somewhere that shouldn't be acceptableIn light of recent data breaches at other high profile Password managers I raised questions about there security to ensure their customers don't end up like both last pss and Nord pass witch I will say although it took a while I did get the question answers
